Welcome to Walmartville, where the lines between “work” and “life” have been blurred, merged, and finally obliterated.

Walmart just built a 350-acre corporate utopia in Bentonville, Arkansas — complete with bike trails, cryotherapy rooms, rooftop lounges, pickleball courts, and… a Walmart museum with a Sam Walton hologram. Because nothing says “top talent” like talking to Ghost Sam while you’re stuck working late.

This isn’t just an office. It’s a company town with yoga mats.

title: COMPANY TOWNS ARE BACK! - WALMART EDITION
